sen.j: 木曜会（もくようかい）とは、明治時代に存在した貴族院_(日本)の院内会派（1897年7月28日－1913年1月26日、なお院内交渉団体としての成立は1898年3月10日）。
sen.e: Mokuyo-kai refers to a faction within the Diet of House of Lords (Japan) in the Meiji Period (July 28, 1897 - January 26, 1913, in addition it was established as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet on March 10, 1898).

Mokuyo-kai refers to a faction within the Diet of House of Lords (Japan) in the Meiji Period (July 28, 1897 - January 26, 1913, in addition it was established as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet on March 10, 1898).

Mokuyo-kai refers to a faction within the Diet of House of Lords (Japan) in the Meiji Period (July 28, 1897 - January 26, 1913, in addition it was established as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet on March 10, 1898).

sen.j: 研究会_(貴族院)の千家尊福ら男爵議員が離脱して結成された。
sen.e: It was formed by baronial members of an assembly including Takatomi SENGE who left from the Kenkyu-kai (the House of Peers).
It was formed by baronial members of an assembly including Takatomi SENGE who left from the Kenkyu-kai (the House of Peers).
It was formed by baronial members of an assembly including Takatomi SENGE who left from the Kenkyu-kai (the House of Peers).

sen.j: なお、この名称は研究会の旧称に由来している。
sen.e: The name of Mokuyo-kai comes from the former name of the Kenkyu-kai.
The name of Mokuyo-kai comes from the former name of the Kenkyu-kai.
The name of Mokuyo-kai comes from the former name of the Kenkyu-kai.

sen.j: 貴族院の成立後、議員の身分ごとに院内会派結成の動きが見られたが、男爵出身者にはこうした動きが見られず、木曜会→研究会などの各会派に分散していた。
sen.e: After the House of Peers was established, there was a movement in formation of a faction within the Diet in accordance with the rank of a councilor, but it was not for baronial members, so the members in the Mokuyo-kai dispersed into every faction such as the Kenkyu-kai.
sen.cmt: 「木曜会→研究会などの各会派に分散」の「→」は、『から』と解釈し英訳しました。
sen.e: After the House of Peers was established, there was a movement in formation of a faction within the Diet in accordance with the rank of a councilor, but it was not for baronial members, so the members in the Mokuyo-kai dispersed into every faction such as the Kenkyu-kai.

After the House of Peers was established, there was a movement in formation of a faction within the Diet in accordance with the rank of a councilor, but it was not for baronial members, so the members in the Mokuyo-kai dispersed into every faction such as the Kenkyu-kai.

sen.j: 当時の研究会は結成母体となった子爵議員と清浦奎吾を筆頭とする実務に通じた勅撰議員が力を有しており、男爵議員の立場は弱かった。
sen.e: In the Kenkyu-kai at that time the viscount councilors who were focal members for forming the faction as well as the nominated members of the House of Peers who were sufficient for know-how including Keigo KIYOURA had power, thus baronial members were in a vulnerable position.

In the Kenkyu-kai at that time the viscount councilors who were focal members for forming the faction as well as the nominated members of the House of Peers who were sufficient for know-how including Keigo KIYOURA had power, thus baronial members were in a vulnerable position.

In the Kenkyu-kai at that time the viscount councilors who were focal members for forming the faction as well as the nominated members of the House of Peers who were sufficient for know-how including Keigo KIYOURA had power, thus baronial members were in a vulnerable position.

sen.j: こうした状況に不満を抱いた千家や杉渓言長らは男爵議員の総結集を目指した。
sen.e: Some members such as SENGE and Tokinaga SUGITANI were dissatisfied with such circumstances and aimed to mobilize entire baronial members.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some members such as SENGE and Tokinaga SUGITANI were dissatisfied with such circumstances and aimed to mobilize entire baronial members.
Some members such as SENGE and Tokinaga SUGITANI were dissatisfied with such circumstances and aimed to mobilize entire baronial members.

sen.j: そして1897年の有爵議員の互選直後に研究会所属の男爵議員16名で立ち上げたのが木曜会であった。
sen.e: Then, the Mokuyo-kai was formed by 16 baronial members who were belonging to the Kenkyu-kai just after the mutual vote for titled members in 1897.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, the Mokuyo-kai was formed by 16 baronial members who were belonging to the Kenkyu-kai just after the mutual vote for titled members in 1897.
Then, the Mokuyo-kai was formed by 16 baronial members who were belonging to the Kenkyu-kai just after the mutual vote for titled members in 1897.

sen.j: この反響は大きく、翌年には他会派の男爵議員や勅撰議員の加入によって院内交渉団体として認められた。
sen.e: With the intense reaction to this, the Mokuyo-kai was recognized as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet through join of baronial members in other factions and nominated members of the House of Peers the following year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the intense reaction to this, the Mokuyo-kai was recognized as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet through join of baronial members in other factions and nominated members of the House of Peers the following year.

With the intense reaction to this, the Mokuyo-kai was recognized as a group having a legislative bargaining position in the Diet through join of baronial members in other factions and nominated members of the House of Peers the following year.

sen.j: 1904年の男爵議員互選において全56議席中43議席を獲得して総計46名、5年後には53名（勅撰議員6名含む）に膨らみ男爵議員のほとんどと勅撰議員の一部を加えた中堅会派となった。
sen.e: Under the mutual vote for baronial members in 1904, the group captured 43 of the 56 seats for a total of 46 members and increased to 53 members (including 6 nominated members) five years later, so it became a medium-sized faction with most of the baronial members and some of the nominated members.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Under the mutual vote for baronial members in 1904, the group captured 43 of the 56 seats for a total of 46 members and increased to 53 members (including 6 nominated members) five years later, so it became a medium-sized faction with most of the baronial members and some of the nominated members.

Under the mutual vote for baronial members in 1904, the group captured 43 of the 56 seats for a total of 46 members and increased to 53 members (including 6 nominated members) five years later, so it became a medium-sized faction with most of the baronial members and some of the nominated members.

sen.j: ところが、代表者である千家は元々伊藤博文の勧めで神道家から政界に転じた人物で伊藤系の立憲政友会に近い立場であった。
sen.e: However, the representative of the group, Senge shifted to a politician from Shintoist at Hirobumi ITO's suggestion, so his position was close to the Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government Party) which Ito formed.

However, the representative of the group, Senge shifted to a politician from Shintoist at Hirobumi ITO's suggestion, so his position was close to the Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government Party) which Ito formed.

However, the representative of the group, Senge shifted to a politician from Shintoist at Hirobumi ITO's suggestion, so his position was close to the Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government Party) which Ito formed.

sen.j: このため、1908年に千家は第1次西園寺内閣の司法大臣として入閣する。
sen.e: Consequently, Senge joined the first Saionji Cabinet as the Minister of Justice in 1908.
Consequently, Senge joined the first Saionji Cabinet as the Minister of Justice in 1908.
Consequently, Senge joined the first Saionji Cabinet as the Minister of Justice in 1908.

sen.j: ところが、木曜会内部には政党に否定的な議員も多く、この入閣を機に内紛が勃発。
sen.e: However, inside of the Mokuyo-kai there were many members who had disapproval of the political party and then after Senge joined the Cabinet, internal disputes broke out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, inside of the Mokuyo-kai there were many members who had disapproved of the political party and then after Senge joined the Cabinet, internal disputes broke out.
sen.cmt: who had disapproval of →who had disapproved of
sen.e: However, inside of the Mokuyo-kai there were many members who had disapproved of the political party and then after Senge joined the Cabinet, internal disputes broke out.

sen.j: 1910年に10名が木曜会を離脱、その後も離脱者が続いて2月13日に中川興長ら17名で清交会（せいこうかい）を結成して木曜会は分裂した。
sen.e: In 1910 ten members left from the Mokuyo-kai as well as others left one after another and consequently 17 members including Okinaga NAKAGAWA formed the Seiko-kai on February 13, so the Mokuyo-kai was disrupted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1910 ten members left from the Mokuyo-kai as well as others left one after another and consequently 17 members including Okinaga NAKAGAWA formed the Seiko-kai on February 13, so the Mokuyo-kai was disrupted.

In 1910 ten members left from the Mokuyo-kai as well as others left one after another and consequently 17 members including Okinaga NAKAGAWA formed the Seiko-kai on February 13, so the Mokuyo-kai was disrupted.

sen.j: だが、その後も木曜会・清交会ともに分裂と離脱が相次ぎ、まず1911年3月に清交会が解散して無所属団などに分散された。
sen.e: Yet, both the Mokuyo-kai and Seiko-kai continued to be disrupted and some of those members left from the groups and then the Seiko-kai was dissolved at first in March 1911 and diverged in various factions such as the Independent Party.

Yet, both the Mokuyo-kai and Seiko-kai continued to be disrupted and some of those members left from the groups and then the Seiko-kai was dissolved at first in March 1911 and diverged in various factions such as the Independent Party.

Yet, both the Mokuyo-kai and Seiko-kai continued to be disrupted and some of those members left from the groups and then the Seiko-kai was dissolved at first in March 1911 and diverged in various factions such as the Independent Party.

sen.j: 同年の男爵議員互選でわすか6議席獲得にとどまって総計10名にまで縮小した木曜会も1913年には解散して研究会に復帰する者と土曜会に合流する者に分裂した。
sen.e: The Mokuyo-kai which reduced to a total of ten members with capturing only six seats in the mutual vote for baronial members in 1911 was also dissolved and some of the members returned to the Kenkyu-kai and others joined to the Doyo-kai.

The Mokuyo-kai which reduced to a total of ten members with capturing only six seats in the mutual vote for baronial members in 1911 was also dissolved and some of the members returned to the Kenkyu-kai and others joined the Doyo-kai.
sen.cmt: joined to the の to は必要ないです。
sen.e: The Mokuyo-kai which reduced to a total of ten members with capturing only six seats in the mutual vote for baronial members in 1911 was also dissolved and some of the members returned to the Kenkyu-kai and others joined the Doyo-kai.

sen.j: 以後、1919年の公正会結成運動まで男爵議員の分散状態は続くことになった。
sen.e: After that, the circumstances of the baronial members disassembled continued until forming the Kousei-kai in 1919.
After that, the circumstances of the baronial members disassembled continued until the Kousei-kai was formed in 1919.
sen.cmt: forming the ともってくるよりは… was formed in とした方が文がすっきりします。
sen.e: After that, the circumstances of the baronial members disassembled continued until the Kousei-kai was formed in 1919.
